pull.title: test: use MiniWallet for rpc_scantxoutset.py
pull.body:
This PR enables one more of the non-wallet functional tests (rpc_scantxoutset.py) to be run even with the Bitcoin Core wallet disabled by using the MiniWallet instead, as proposed in #20078 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23858#issue-1088320649 more recently.

Reviewer's guide:
* [commit 1/3] For replacing the getnewaddress/getaddressinfo RPC calls a helper `getnewdestination` is introduced which allows to create addresses with the common address format types ('legacy', 'p2sh-segwit' and 'bech32'), but also additionally returns the corresponding pubkey and output script.
* [commit 2/3] In order to send to addresses with MiniWallet, a helper `address_to_scriptpubkey` is introduced. It only supports legacy addresses (Base58Check) so far, which is sufficient for the scantxoutset test.
* [commit 3/3] With those helpers, the use of MiniWallet in the test is quite straight-forward. To avoid repeatedly specifying parameters like `from_node` to MiniWallet's `send_to` method, another test-internal helper `sendtodestination` is introduced which supports specifying the destination both as outputscript or as address.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

events.message:
test: introduce `getnewdestination` helper for generating various address types

This serves as a replacement for the getnewaddress RPC if no wallet is
available. In addition to the address, it also returns the corresponding
public key and output script (scriptPubKey).

test: introduce `address_to_scriptpubkey` helper

Works only with legacy addresses (Base58Check) right now.

events.body:
Nice. Looks very good.

Left some questions on the third commit for unrelated lines.

events.message:
test: use MiniWallet for rpc_scantxoutset.py

This test can now be run even with the Bitcoin Core wallet disabled.

events.body:
Force-pushed with most of the suggestions by MarcoFalke (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23866#pullrequestreview-840078708):
- use pre-mined chain instead of manually generating new blocks
- remove unnecessary node restarts

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,47 +24,42 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         self.num_nodes = 1
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
 
-    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
-        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
+    def sendtodestination(self, destination, amount):
+        # interpret strings as addresses, assume scriptPubKey otherwise
+        if isinstance(destination, str):
+            destination = address_to_scriptpubkey(destination)
comments.body:
last commit:

An alternative would be `self.nodes[0].validateaddress(destination)['scriptPubKey']`, but both work fine.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,47 +24,42 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         self.num_nodes = 1
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
 
-    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
-        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
+    def sendtodestination(self, destination, amount):
+        # interpret strings as addresses, assume scriptPubKey otherwise
+        if isinstance(destination, str):
+            destination = address_to_scriptpubkey(destination)
+        self.wallet.send_to(from_node=self.nodes[0], scriptPubKey=destination, amount=int(COIN * amount))
 
     def run_test(self):
         self.log.info("Mining blocks...")
-        self.generate(self.nodes[0], 110)
+        self.wallet = MiniWallet(self.nodes[0])
+        self.generate(self.wallet, 120)
comments.body: Could this use the pre-mined chain?

         self.generate(self.nodes[0], 1)
 
-        self.log.info("Stop node, remove wallet, mine again some blocks...")
-        self.stop_node(0)
-        shutil.rmtree(os.path.join(self.nodes[0].datadir, self.chain, 'wallets'))
-        self.start_node(0, ['-nowallet'])
-        self.import_deterministic_coinbase_privkeys()
+        self.log.info("Restart node, mine again some blocks...")
+        self.restart_node(0)
         self.generate(self.nodes[0], 110)

@@ -20,47 +24,42 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         self.num_nodes = 1
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
 
-    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
-        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
+    def sendtodestination(self, destination, amount):
+        # interpret strings as addresses, assume scriptPubKey otherwise

+            destination = address_to_scriptpubkey(destination)
+        self.wallet.send_to(from_node=self.nodes[0], scriptPubKey=destination, amount=int(COIN * amount))
 
     def run_test(self):
         self.log.info("Mining blocks...")
-        self.generate(self.nodes[0], 110)
+        self.wallet = MiniWallet(self.nodes[0])
+        self.generate(self.wallet, 120)
comments.body: Good idea. Ironically to use the pre-mined chain MiniWallet needs the call exactly the RPC that this test checks (scantxoutset), but I don't think it is a problem. Done.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,47 +24,42 @@ def set_test_params(self):
         self.num_nodes = 1
         self.setup_clean_chain = True
 
-    def skip_test_if_missing_module(self):
-        self.skip_if_no_wallet()
+    def sendtodestination(self, destination, amount):
+        # interpret strings as addresses, assume scriptPubKey otherwise
+        if isinstance(destination, str):
+            destination = address_to_scriptpubkey(destination)
comments.body: Ah nice, for some reason I thought `getaddressinfo` is the only RPC that can do that. Decided to keep as it is though, to need fewer RPC calls (can be changed if other reviewers prefer to call `validateaddress`).
I don't think it is, removed it.

comments.body: Hm, I don't think creating more blocks has any value for the test. Removed it.
